definition: Yan Yuan (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as 顏回|颜回[Yan2 Hui2]
surname Yan
Japanese variant of 顏|颜[yan2]
color/face/countenance
deep pool/deep/profound

sentences.english: However, Yan Yuan's distinct character was continuous self-renewal to perfect virtues.
sentences.chinese: 然而颜渊之本色，在自强不息以进德。

sentences.english: Confucius' disciple, Yan Yuan, on the other hand, died at age thirty, so he's said to have been short-lived.
sentences.chinese: 颜渊是孔子的学生，活到三十岁就死了，所以叫命短。

sentences.english: Yen-Yuan occupied a high position among the disciples of Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 颜渊在孔门弟子中之地位甚高。

definition: Yan Hui (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Yan Yuan 顏淵|颜渊[Yan2 Yuan1]
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Zi Lu (542-480 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as Ji Lu 季路[Ji4 Lu4]
Zi Gong or Duanmu Ci 端木賜|端木赐[Duan1 mu4 Ci4] (520 BC-), disciple of Confucius
Zengzi (505-435 BC), student of Confucius, presumed editor or author of Confucian classic the Great Learning 大學|大学[Da4 xue2]
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Confucius' school (i.e. his direct disciples)
Confucius
another name for Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
Zai Yu (522-458 BC), disciple of Confucius
Master/(old form of address for teachers, scholars)/pedant
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
the Sage Confucius
courtesy name for Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Mencius 孟子 (c. 372-c. 289), Confucian philosopher
